result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Truby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael A. Truby is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael A. Truby was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.
  • Michael A. Truby was found guilty of Intentionally Abuse Hazardous Substance, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.316(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cash bond of $500 has been applied.

records.addlTxt: defendant's notice of cert -    not deliverable as addressed -

Called with 17fa95-Defendant present in court. Defendant states he is prepared to pay $300 today; $100 next Friday and will be paid in full by 12/30/17. Court quashes warrant with payment today and schedules review hearing for February 5, 2018.
vol. app. - notified Mary @ ONSO - Per Mary, do not have warrant/bjb
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

3:46 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Truby in court. Defendant statement that just got caught up with child support - requests $50 payment plan per month. Can make $50 payment today and $50 payment Friday. Defendant will pay more each month. Review date to remain.  Review hearing scheduled for October 16, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

3:18 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Truby in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf291 and 16cf130. Pfeifer states agreement. State moves to amend Count 1 in 15CF291 to remove passenger under 16 years to OWI cause Injury - a misdemeanor - Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 2 in 15CF291 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 16cf130 in its entirety. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Counts 1 and 3.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Pfeifer/Arbuckle/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 2 years each count - CC
Fine - $300 plus costs
Driver's license revocation - 7 months
Jail - 30 days with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before January 20, 2017 at 8:00 a.m. 
Jail credit - 55 days if revoked
Driver's safety plan
AODA asssessment
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Cash bond to be applied to fine. 
Adj.  Review hearing scheduled for May 15, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael A. Truby in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:01
Calling 15cf291 and 16cf130 - 
Arbuckle statement - offer made - but need to time to go over with Client- request adjournment = Court statement to no information /arraignment in 16cf130 - Arbuckle statement - to be dismissed as part of agreement
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 6, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.
States Continued Reply to Discovery
Jury trial on December 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Called w/16CF130 - jury remains scheduled for 9/6 and 9/7/16.

2:16 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Truby in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Paul Arbuckle appearing telephonically. Calling 15cf291 and 16cf130. Schiek statement to status of cases - Voorhees statement - moves to withdraw as counsel in both cases as Arbuckle has been retained - Motion Granted. Arbuckle statement - need to reschedule prelimin. Bail continued. Trial date remains. Prelmin date in 16cf130 will also be pre-trial conference in 15cf291. Adj. 2:20 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.

3:16 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Truby in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states that no resolution has been reached - requests jury trial. Bail continued. Adj. 3:20 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
State's Reply to Discovery continued

1:43 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Truby in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement to negotiations - resolution is close - waiting for further toxicology reports from Madison. Bail continued. Adj. 1:45 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
State's Reply to Discovery continued
Includes $4500 signature bond

Immediately upon release make appointment with Chris Hartlep- confirmation to be provided by Chris Hartlep to Court that contact was made within 72 hours - follow-through with all AODA treatment; follow-through with all Social Services orders/requests including blood testing - No intoxicants to include alcohol, any controlled substances or hazardous substances as defined in statute. Also Signature bond in amount of $4500.00.

9:36 a.m. Defendant Michael A. Truby in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Michael A. Truby in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig in receipt of separation summary from Koinonia. Voorhees/Michlig statement to motion. Defendant will live at 3965 Lakewood Road, Apt. 3, Harshaw, WI. Court statement on motion - Court modifies to $5,000 bond  - $4,500 signature, $500 Cash- Conditions to be: immediately upon release make appointment with Chris Hartlep - confirmation to be provided to Court by Chris Hartlep that contact was made within 72 hours - follow-through with all AODA treatment; follow-through with all Social Services orders/requests including blood testing - No intoxicants to include alcohol control substances or hazardous substances as defined in statute. Adj. 9:54 a.m.
Defense Exhibit - treatment records
to modify bail
1/19/16 Letter from Koininia - ordered sealed by the Court

10:48 a.m. Defendant Michael A. Truby in court with attorney John E Voorhees. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig statement--no resolution at this time/waiting for blood test results; requests adj. Voorhees statement--requests bail review. Michlig statement--understands defendant discharged from Koininia but no discharge summary report; objects to modification. 01/19/16 Letter from Koininia filed by Voorhees; sealed by the Court. Voorhees statement--requests bond modification. Court statement--denies modification at this time; would like more details. Upon Voorhees providing summary report to DA/Court, bond may be addressed. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 01-27-2016 10:30 am
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

11:04 a.m. Defendant Michael A. Truby in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Michael A. Truby in custody.  State of Wisconsin does not appear. Voorhees in receipt of Information - waive further reading - enters pleas of not guilty to all counts. Traffic citations to track with this case. Voorhees statement to modification of bond - possible admission to Koinonia in January - Court will grant - will consider day for day jail credit on any potential sentence if successfully completes. Voorhees states waiting for some discovery - including blood test results. Adj. 11:07 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.

3:52 p.m. Defendant Michael A. Truby in court via video with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees states believes Defendant should be here in person. Bail continued. Adj. 3:54 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.

11:37 a.m. Defendant Michael A. Truby in court, in custody, with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig calls Deputy Michael Baran, sworn, direct. Witness identifies defendant. Cross by Voorhees. 11:56 a.m. off record. 11:57 a.m. back on record. All parties present. Voorhees continues with cross examination. Voorhees--motion to dismiss. Court statement. Michlig statement--requests leave to supplement record with statute. 12:09 p.m. off the record. 12:15 p.m. back on record. All parties present. Court statement -- notes 25D intoxicants now includes inhalants. Court finds probable cause exists and binds over for trial. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 12-18-2015 11:30 am

Defendant Michael A. Truby in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Michael A. Truby in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:43
In receipt, again waive reading - request bail be revisted - gives statement - Michlig statement - Court statement - continues bail as previously set
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 11:30 am.
No possession of aerosol-type product. AODA assessment and follow-up treatment.

Voorhees  states defendant is eligible for representation.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement to bond - Court sets $ cash bond.
